children.name: according
children.sourceText: Even this mortal shall put on immortality, and this corruption shall put on incorruption, and shall be brought to stand before the bar of God, to be judged of him according to their works whether they be good or whether they be evil, If they be good, to the resurrection of endless life and happiness; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of endless damnation, being delivered up to the devil, who hath subjected them, which is damnation; Having gone according to their own carnal wills and desires; having never called upon the Lord while the arms of mercy were extended towards them; for the arms of mercy were extended towards them, and they would not; they being warned of their iniquities and yet they would not depart from them; and they were commanded to repent and yet they would not repent.

children.name: a
children.sourceText: Why do ye commit whoredoms and spend your strength with harlots, yea, and cause this people to commit sin, that the Lord has cause to send me to prophesy against this people, yea, even a great evil against this people?

children.name: about
children.sourceText: And thus the Lord bringeth about the restoration of these; and they have a part in the first resurrection, or have eternal life, being redeemed by the Lord.

children.name: after
children.sourceText: But this much I tell you, what you do with me, after this, shall be as a type and a shadow of things which are to come.

children.name: all
children.sourceText: Have ye done all this?

children.name: among
children.sourceText: Have they not said that God himself should come down among the children of men, and take upon him the form of man, and go forth in mighty power upon the face of the earth?

children.name: an
children.sourceText: Behold, I say unto you, that when his soul has been made an offering for sin he shall see his seed.

children.name: and
children.sourceText: Behold, thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me, saying, and thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me.

children.name: any
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Nay, they did not all understand the law; and this because of the hardness of their hearts; for they understood not that there could not any man be saved except it were through the redemption of God.

children.name: as
children.sourceText: But this much I tell you, what you do with me, after this, shall be as a type and a shadow of things which are to come.

children.name: at
children.sourceText: Touch me not, for God shall smite you if ye lay your hands upon me, for I have not delivered the message which the Lord sent me to deliver; neither have I told you that which ye requested that I should tell; therefore, God will not suffer that I shall be destroyed at this time.

children.name: because
children.sourceText: But I must fulfil the commandments wherewith God has commanded me; and because I have told you the truth ye are angry with me.

children.name: before
children.sourceText: Yea, ye know that I speak the truth; and you ought to tremble before God.

children.name: betwixt
children.sourceText: And thus God breaketh the bands of death, having gained the victory over death; giving the Son power to make intercession for the children of men, Having ascended into heaven, having the bowels of mercy; being filled with compassion towards the children of men; standing betwixt them and justice; having broken the bands of death, taken upon himself their iniquity and their transgressions, having redeemed them, and satisfied the demands of justice.

children.name: but
children.sourceText: But I must fulfil the commandments wherewith God has commanded me; and because I have told you the truth ye are angry with me.

children.name: by
children.sourceText: Doth salvation come by the law of Moses?

children.name: can
children.sourceText: For salvation cometh to none such; for the Lord hath redeemed none such; yea, neither can the Lord redeem such; for he cannot deny himself; for he cannot deny justice when it has its claim.

children.name: concerning
children.sourceText: And what know ye concerning the law of Moses?

children.name: could
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Nay, they did not all understand the law; and this because of the hardness of their hearts; for they understood not that there could not any man be saved except it were through the redemption of God.

children.name: down
children.sourceText: Have they not said that God himself should come down among the children of men, and take upon him the form of man, and go forth in mighty power upon the face of the earth?

children.name: except
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Nay, they did not all understand the law; and this because of the hardness of their hearts; for they understood not that there could not any man be saved except it were through the redemption of God.

children.name: for
children.sourceText: I say unto you, wo be unto you for perverting the ways of the Lord!

children.name: fro
children.sourceText: Yea, and ye shall be smitten on every hand, and shall be driven and scattered to and fro, even as a wild flock is driven by wild and ferocious beasts.

children.name: from
children.sourceText: And now I say unto you that it was expedient that there should be a law given to the children of Israel, yea, even a very strict law; for they were a stiffnecked people, quick to do iniquity, and slow to remember the Lord their God; Therefore there was a law given them, yea, a law of performances and of ordinances, a law which they were to observe strictly from day to day, to keep them in remembrance of God and their duty towards him.

children.name: he
children.sourceText: Behold, thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me, saying, and thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me.

children.name: him
children.sourceText: And now I say unto you that it was expedient that there should be a law given to the children of Israel, yea, even a very strict law; for they were a stiffnecked people, quick to do iniquity, and slow to remember the Lord their God; Therefore there was a law given them, yea, a law of performances and of ordinances, a law which they were to observe strictly from day to day, to keep them in remembrance of God and their duty towards him.

children.name: himself
children.sourceText: And moreover, I say unto you, that salvation doth not come by the law alone; and were it not for the atonement, which God himself shall make for the sins and iniquities of his people, that they must unavoidably perish, notwithstanding the law of Moses.

children.name: his
children.sourceText: And moreover, I say unto you, that salvation doth not come by the law alone; and were it not for the atonement, which God himself shall make for the sins and iniquities of his people, that they must unavoidably perish, notwithstanding the law of Moses.

children.name: I
children.sourceText: I say unto you, wo be unto you for perverting the ways of the Lord!

children.name: if
children.sourceText: For if ye understand these things ye have not taught them; therefore, ye have perverted the ways of the Lord.

children.name: in
children.sourceText: I know if ye keep the commandments of God ye shall be saved; yea, if ye keep the commandments which the Lord delivered unto Moses in the mount of Sinai, saying:

children.name: into
children.sourceText: And thus God breaketh the bands of death, having gained the victory over death; giving the Son power to make intercession for the children of men, Having ascended into heaven, having the bowels of mercy; being filled with compassion towards the children of men; standing betwixt them and justice; having broken the bands of death, taken upon himself their iniquity and their transgressions, having redeemed them, and satisfied the demands of justice.

children.name: it
children.sourceText: If ye teach the law of Moses why do ye not keep it?

children.name: its
children.sourceText: For salvation cometh to none such; for the Lord hath redeemed none such; yea, neither can the Lord redeem such; for he cannot deny himself; for he cannot deny justice when it has its claim.

children.name: many
children.sourceText: And after all this, after working many mighty miracles among the children of men, he shall be led, yea, even as Isaiah said, Yea, even so he shall be led, crucified, and slain, the flesh becoming subject even unto death, the will of the Son being swallowed up in the will of the Father.

children.name: may
children.sourceText: I say unto you, I will not recall the words which I have spoken unto you concerning this people, for they are true; and that ye may know of their surety I have suffered myself that I have fallen into your hands.

children.name: me
children.sourceText: Behold, thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me, saying, and thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me.

children.name: most
children.sourceText: And now I read unto you the remainder of the commandments of God, for I perceive that they are not written in your hearts; I perceive that ye have studied and taught iniquity the most part of your lives.

children.name: must
children.sourceText: But I must fulfil the commandments wherewith God has commanded me; and because I have told you the truth ye are angry with me.

children.name: my
children.sourceText: Ye see that ye have not power to slay me, therefore I finish my message.

children.name: myself
children.sourceText: I say unto you, I will not recall the words which I have spoken unto you concerning this people, for they are true; and that ye may know of their surety I have suffered myself that I have fallen into your hands.

children.name: neither
children.sourceText: Touch me not, for God shall smite you if ye lay your hands upon me, for I have not delivered the message which the Lord sent me to deliver; neither have I told you that which ye requested that I should tell; therefore, God will not suffer that I shall be destroyed at this time.

children.name: none
children.sourceText: But behold, and fear, and tremble before God, for ye ought to tremble; for the Lord redeemeth none such that rebel against him and die in their sins; yea, even all those that have perished in their sins ever since the world began, that have wilfully rebelled against God, that have known the commandments of God, and would not keep them; these are they that have no part in the first resurrection.

children.name: o
children.sourceText: And O how beautiful upon the mountains were their feet!

children.name: of
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: on
children.sourceText: But remember that he that persists in his own carnal nature, and goes on in the ways of sin and rebellion against God, remaineth in his fallen state and the devil hath all power over him.

children.name: one
children.sourceText: And because he dwelleth in flesh he shall be called the Son of God, and having subjected the flesh to the will of the Father, being the Father and the Son, The Father, because he was conceived by the power of God; and the Son, because of the flesh; thus becoming the Father and Son, And they are one God, yea, the very Eternal Father of heaven and of earth.

children.name: or
children.sourceText: Yea, and even all the prophets who have prophesied ever since the world began have they not spoken more or less concerning these things?

children.name: our
children.sourceText: For they are carnal and devilish, and the devil has power over them; yea, even that old serpent that did beguile our first parents, which was the cause of their fall; which was the cause of all mankind becoming carnal, sensual, devilish, knowing evil from good, subjecting themselves to the devil.

children.name: out
children.sourceText: And thus the flesh becoming subject to the Spirit, or the Son to the Father, being one God, suffereth temptation, and yieldeth not to the temptation, but suffereth himself to be mocked, and scourged, and cast out, and disowned by his people.

children.name: over
children.sourceText: And thus God breaketh the bands of death, having gained the victory over death; giving the Son power to make intercession for the children of men, Having ascended into heaven, having the bowels of mercy; being filled with compassion towards the children of men; standing betwixt them and justice; having broken the bands of death, taken upon himself their iniquity and their transgressions, having redeemed them, and satisfied the demands of justice.

children.name: shall
children.sourceText: And it shall come to pass that ye shall be smitten for your iniquities, for ye have said that ye teach the law of Moses.

children.name: should
children.sourceText: And have ye taught this people that they should do all these things?

children.name: since
children.sourceText: Yea, and even all the prophets who have prophesied ever since the world began have they not spoken more or less concerning these things?

children.name: so
children.sourceText: But I finish my message; and then it matters not whither I go, if it so be that I am saved.

children.name: such
children.sourceText: But behold, and fear, and tremble before God, for ye ought to tremble; for the Lord redeemeth none such that rebel against him and die in their sins; yea, even all those that have perished in their sins ever since the world began, that have wilfully rebelled against God, that have known the commandments of God, and would not keep them; these are they that have no part in the first resurrection.

children.name: that
children.sourceText: Why do ye commit whoredoms and spend your strength with harlots, yea, and cause this people to commit sin, that the Lord has cause to send me to prophesy against this people, yea, even a great evil against this people?

children.name: the
children.sourceText: Behold, thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me, saying, and thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me.

children.name: their
children.sourceText: And now I say unto you that it was expedient that there should be a law given to the children of Israel, yea, even a very strict law; for they were a stiffnecked people, quick to do iniquity, and slow to remember the Lord their God; Therefore there was a law given them, yea, a law of performances and of ordinances, a law which they were to observe strictly from day to day, to keep them in remembrance of God and their duty towards him.

children.name: them
children.sourceText: For if ye understand these things ye have not taught them; therefore, ye have perverted the ways of the Lord.

children.name: themselves
children.sourceText: For they are carnal and devilish, and the devil has power over them; yea, even that old serpent that did beguile our first parents, which was the cause of their fall; which was the cause of all mankind becoming carnal, sensual, devilish, knowing evil from good, subjecting themselves to the devil.

children.name: there
children.sourceText: And now I say unto you that it was expedient that there should be a law given to the children of Israel, yea, even a very strict law; for they were a stiffnecked people, quick to do iniquity, and slow to remember the Lord their God; Therefore there was a law given them, yea, a law of performances and of ordinances, a law which they were to observe strictly from day to day, to keep them in remembrance of God and their duty towards him.

children.name: therefore
children.sourceText: For if ye understand these things ye have not taught them; therefore, ye have perverted the ways of the Lord.

children.name: these
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: they
children.sourceText: And have ye taught this people that they should do all these things?

children.name: this
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: those
children.sourceText: Behold I say unto you, that whosoever has heard the words of the prophets, yea, all the holy prophets who have prophesied concerning the coming of the Lord, I say unto you, that all those who have hearkened unto their words, and believed that the Lord would redeem his people, and have looked forward to that day for a remission of their sins, I say unto you, that these are his seed, or they are heirs of the kingdom of God.

children.name: though
children.sourceText: Therefore he is as though there was no redemption made, being an enemy to God; and also is the devil an enemy to God.

children.name: through
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Nay, they did not all understand the law; and this because of the hardness of their hearts; for they understood not that there could not any man be saved except it were through the redemption of God.

children.name: thus
children.sourceText: Behold, thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me, saying, and thus saith the Lord, and thus hath he commanded me.

children.name: thy
children.sourceText: Thy God reigneth!

children.name: to
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: towards
children.sourceText: And now I say unto you that it was expedient that there should be a law given to the children of Israel, yea, even a very strict law; for they were a stiffnecked people, quick to do iniquity, and slow to remember the Lord their God; Therefore there was a law given them, yea, a law of performances and of ordinances, a law which they were to observe strictly from day to day, to keep them in remembrance of God and their duty towards him.

children.name: until
children.sourceText: And there cometh a resurrection, even a first resurrection; yea, even a resurrection of those that have been, and who are, and who shall be, even until the resurrection of Christ, for so shall he be called.

children.name: unto
children.sourceText: Thus has the Lord commanded me, saying, And the Lord said unto me:

children.name: up
children.sourceText: And after all this, after working many mighty miracles among the children of men, he shall be led, yea, even as Isaiah said, Yea, even so he shall be led, crucified, and slain, the flesh becoming subject even unto death, the will of the Son being swallowed up in the will of the Father.

children.name: upon
children.sourceText: Why do ye set your hearts upon riches?

children.name: what
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: whether
children.sourceText: Even this mortal shall put on immortality, and this corruption shall put on incorruption, and shall be brought to stand before the bar of God, to be judged of him according to their works whether they be good or whether they be evil, If they be good, to the resurrection of endless life and happiness; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of endless damnation, being delivered up to the devil, who hath subjected them, which is damnation; Having gone according to their own carnal wills and desires; having never called upon the Lord while the arms of mercy were extended towards them; for the arms of mercy were extended towards them, and they would not; they being warned of their iniquities and yet they would not depart from them; and they were commanded to repent and yet they would not repent.

children.name: which
children.sourceText: I know if ye keep the commandments of God ye shall be saved; yea, if ye keep the commandments which the Lord delivered unto Moses in the mount of Sinai, saying:

children.name: while
children.sourceText: Even this mortal shall put on immortality, and this corruption shall put on incorruption, and shall be brought to stand before the bar of God, to be judged of him according to their works whether they be good or whether they be evil, If they be good, to the resurrection of endless life and happiness; and if they be evil, to the resurrection of endless damnation, being delivered up to the devil, who hath subjected them, which is damnation; Having gone according to their own carnal wills and desires; having never called upon the Lord while the arms of mercy were extended towards them; for the arms of mercy were extended towards them, and they would not; they being warned of their iniquities and yet they would not depart from them; and they were commanded to repent and yet they would not repent.

children.name: who
children.sourceText: Yea, and even all the prophets who have prophesied ever since the world began have they not spoken more or less concerning these things?

children.name: whom
children.sourceText: For these are they whose sins he has borne; these are they for whom he has died, to redeem them from their transgressions.

children.name: whose
children.sourceText: For these are they whose sins he has borne; these are they for whom he has died, to redeem them from their transgressions.

children.name: whosoever
children.sourceText: Behold I say unto you, that whosoever has heard the words of the prophets, yea, all the holy prophets who have prophesied concerning the coming of the Lord, I say unto you, that all those who have hearkened unto their words, and believed that the Lord would redeem his people, and have looked forward to that day for a remission of their sins, I say unto you, that these are his seed, or they are heirs of the kingdom of God.

children.name: will
children.sourceText: Touch me not, for God shall smite you if ye lay your hands upon me, for I have not delivered the message which the Lord sent me to deliver; neither have I told you that which ye requested that I should tell; therefore, God will not suffer that I shall be destroyed at this time.

children.name: with
children.sourceText: Why do ye commit whoredoms and spend your strength with harlots, yea, and cause this people to commit sin, that the Lord has cause to send me to prophesy against this people, yea, even a great evil against this people?

children.name: would
children.sourceText: I say unto you, Nay; for if ye had, the Lord would not have caused me to come forth and to prophesy evil concerning this people.

children.name: ye
children.sourceText: For if ye understand these things ye have not taught them; therefore, ye have perverted the ways of the Lord.

children.name: yea
children.sourceText: Why do ye commit whoredoms and spend your strength with harlots, yea, and cause this people to commit sin, that the Lord has cause to send me to prophesy against this people, yea, even a great evil against this people?

children.name: yet
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: you
children.sourceText: Are you priests, and pretend to teach this people, and to understand the spirit of prophesying, and yet desire to know of me what these things mean?

children.name: your
children.sourceText: Ye have not applied your hearts to understanding; therefore, ye have not been wise.
